ThingDef.label: Furx
ThingDef.description: Furxes are only found in large numbers on the desolate Rimplanets, where the hunt for their luxurious furs isn't deemed worth the time and effort.

ThingDef.label: Rimdog
ThingDef.description: These friendly canines can be seen wandering around the wilderness in large packs. Some have even been known to wander into town and snag any food they can find lying around.

ThingDef.label: Rimwolf
ThingDef.description: These intelligent creatures have evolved from the wild wolves of Earth which were released on this backwater planet long ago. They are fearsome predators and can quickly overpower large prey that carelessly lets itself get surrounded by them.

ThingDef.label: German Shepherd
ThingDef.description: A large working dog that is usually tan and black in color. It is one of the most intelligent breeds of dog and they are prized for their trainability.

ThingDef.label: Samoyed
ThingDef.description: Nomads on Earth bred these white, fluffy dogs to help with herding and to pull sleds when they traveled.

ThingDef.label: Border Collie
ThingDef.description: A medium-large sized sheepdog that is prized for their intelligence. It is used by shepherds all over the galaxy.

ThingDef.label: Nightling
ThingDef.description: A large deformed beast with rows of quills on its back. The rim is a violent place and the dead are a common sight. But over the years, disturbing reports of ravaged corpses started to increase in surprising numbers, all gut-wrenching and skewered with spikes. Each dawn shedding light to the aftermath of the night before. The locals soon learned to fear the dark, and the nightmares within them.

ThingDef.label: Feathered Raptor
ThingDef.description: Quiet, cunning, elegant and ruthless, these reptile species were originally developed to resolve an increasing warg population problem. Someone quickly realized that adding another alpha predator doesn't help an already broken ecosystem, and the project was cancelled. Scientists then started a new development project that was aimed at making raptors the pets of rich people. Because of that, these raptors now have colorful feathers.

ThingDef.label: Fenrir
ThingDef.description: Gigantic, monstrous wolf-like creatures. Theories differ as to the origin of the Fenrir, although clearly it is related somehow to the more common warg. Perhaps they mutated from the common stock due to radioactive fallout, or perhaps they were intentionally created by some insane glitterworld geneticist. At ease in even the coldest environments, these terrifying beasts predate on human colonies and have an insatiable hunger for flesh. Superstitious tribals view them as proof that that not only is there a god, but it actively hates us. They are even harder to tame and train than their smaller cousins, and are prone to violence if attacked.

ThingDef.label: Mosquito
ThingDef.description: Mosquitoes are small, parasitic, flies whose tube-like mouthparts (called a proboscis) pierce the hosts' skin to consume blood. This rimworld variety has adapted to be omnivorious, but prefers the succelent taste of fresh blood if possible. Mosquitoes are known to carry and spread diseases.

ThingDef.label: Crashbug
ThingDef.description: These fearsome, carnivorous beetle-bugs are small and hard to find, and they can often be fatal if one strikes. They attack by ramming or crashing into their target. This is what earned them their name of Crashbug.

ThingDef.label: Fly
ThingDef.description: The small housefly has evolved on this rimworld to become a common and larger nuisance insect. Flies are known to carry and spread diseases.

ThingDef.label: Flea
ThingDef.description: Fleas are wingless insects with mouthparts adapted for piercing skin and sucking blood. Fleas are external parasites, living by hematophagy off the blood of mammals.

ThingDef.label: Tarantula
ThingDef.description: Tarantulas are carnivorous, eight legged monsters with hideous fangs and a toxic bite! A build up of the toxins can be fatal.

ThingDef.label: Spindlecrib
ThingDef.description: This is one large, poisonous arachnid! Unlike most giant bugs, these spiders naturally evolved this way without the aid of gene manipulation. The name "Spindlecrib" stems from the spider's unique behavior. These spiders drag victims to their lair and spin a crib for their offspring. The victim is used as the spindle for the webbing.

ThingDef.label: Scorpion
ThingDef.description: Scorpions are predatory arachnids with eight legs. The two frontal legs consist of a pair of sharp, grasping claws. They have a segmented tail that ends with a venomous stinger.

ThingDef.label: Feralisk
ThingDef.description: A Feralisk is a different mutation in the family of poisonous spiders. Often called "Megaspiders", these giant arachnids are extremely dangerous predators. Many traveling colonists have fallen victim to these horrors.

ThingDef.label: Terramorph
ThingDef.description: Terramorphs are a type of large beetle with a pair of sharp tusks, thick chitin plating and a toxic bite. They are well adapted to survive in extreme temperatures, be it glacial environments or scorching deserts.

ThingDef.label: Buffalo
ThingDef.description: An Buffalo is larger variation of Muffalo that has survived the harsh landscape of a rimworld. Males have white wool and a pair of horns on their head. Females have brown wool and long, frontal tusks. They can be somewhat aggressive if you get too close.

ThingDef.label: Armored Muffalo
ThingDef.description: A Muffalo is a large herding herbivore that descended from Buffalo and has adapted to some exotic environments. It is peaceful unless disturbed.

ThingDef.label: Quadhog
ThingDef.description: This oversized cousin of the wild boar is four times as aggressive and four times as deadly. Luckily there aren't very many of them running around or life would be even harder than it already is on this remote rimworld.

ThingDef.label: Rimram
ThingDef.description: The thick wool on these rams makes them very common sight in cold climates. They are known for their ability to climb nearly vertical, sheer cliff faces. They have no fear of falling.

ThingDef.label: Snork
ThingDef.description: There's a distinct resemblance between Snorks and Walruses but it's impossible to tell which came first as lot of the datalogs of Earthen fauna has been poorly kept and corrupted. Their tusks are a very high demand luxury item.

ThingDef.label: Hedgehog
ThingDef.description: Hedgehogs are a small, spine covered, herbivorous mammal with a pig-like snout. They can roll into sharp, spikey ball to protect themselves, though some predators are willing to risk minor injury for a tasty snack.

ThingDef.label: Lacosdile
ThingDef.description: A Lacosdile is a crossbred and genetically manipulated lizard originally created as part of clever fragrance marketing gig. Being herbivorous and barely dangerous made them very common pets. However as the trends passed Lacosdiles were soon found flooding the sewage systems, and in desperation were carried off across the galaxy to the furthest reaches of space. As a result the species now flourish on desolate rimworlds, where they have adapted to become omnivorous.
